metadata.title: CVE-2020-10769 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer over-read flaw was found in RH kernel versions before 5.0 incrypto_authenc_extractkeys in crypto/authenc.c in the IPsec Cryptographicalgorithm's module, authenc. When a payload longer than 4 bytes, and is notfollowing 4-byte alignment boundary guidelines, it causes a bufferover-read threat, leading to a system crash. This flaw allows a localattacker with user privileges to cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10769` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-55-generic - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-4.15.0-55-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-4.15.0-55-lowlatency - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-55-generic - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-55-lowlatency - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1043-kvm - 4.4.0-1043.49
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1079-aws - 4.4.0-1079.89
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1051-azure - 4.15.0-1051.56
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-gcp - 4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1018-oracle - 4.15.0-1018.20~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-145.171').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1043.49').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1079.89').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.56').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1018.20~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1106.114').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.115').
